channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14166] Per-Region metrics can be stale
item.description: We're seeing some machines that are reporting only old region metrics. It seems like at some point the Hadoop metrics system decided which metrics to display and which not to. From then on it was not changing.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

This message is automatically generated.
Hmmm let me look a little closer.

TestSplitTransactionOnCluster was force closing a region twice leading to a null pointer. I've fixed that and also tried to shore up a few places that two racing closes could have un-defined behavior.

k, I'll check this in later today unless there are any other comments.

Thanks

This looks like a bug that should be picked back to other active release branches. However this is an interesting change that adds a background task for cleaning the JMX cache and locks for said cleaning. I plan to pick it back in a couple of days but won't if there are concerns or objections.

/cc Nick Dimiduk Enis Soztutar

Agreed. Elliott Clark is this applicable to earlier versions?

If it's wanted I can back port it.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-1.2 #114 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.2/114/)

It's wanted back to 0.98 looks like. If you don't mind backporting, that's great. Otherwise ping me and I'll gladly do it.
Yeah, looks like we should have it back. This cache-buster stuff is nasty business. I'm not so deep into it yet – is this a JMX cache bug or a hadoop metrics2 sink bug, or something else?
Might be a deadlock associated with this: HBASE-14274
Looks like this is still a work in progress so let's not pick it back. Can be backported along with related work later.
looks like this was committed to branch-1 so added fixVersion 1.3.
